str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
(lit: that cannot be cut), an indivisible part of time, a moment. Uncut, i.e. indivisible.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From rhipto; a jerk (by analogy) an instant).
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
A trumpet, the sound of a trumpet. Perhaps from salos; a trumpet.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sound a trumpet. From salpigx; to trumpet, i.e. Sound a blast.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
Indestructible, imperishable, incorruptible; hence: immortal. Undecaying.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To change, alter, exchange, transform. From allos; to make different.
